intro: Echeveria brittonii, commonly known as the Britton's echeveria, is a succulent native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It features rosettes of fleshy, blue-gray leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white powder, known as farina. The plant produces showy pink to purple flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires ample sunlight to maintain its compact shape. Due to its unique appearance and ease of care, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation.
